reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is a really nice mini golf game. It's currently early access on steam so theres quite a lot lacking but what you get now is worth the money I think.

And what you get is two 18 hole courses: Forest and Oasis, played solo or with up to 11 other players. The courses themselves are varied, challenging and at times infuriating. Some holes require a bit of skill to navigate and others just rely on pure luck. At the moment Forest is the most complete level and you'll probably find yourself playing this most. There are currently a few bugs with Oasis that might sour the expirience a bit for you but the developers have a great road map planned out and i'm sure these bugs will be ironed out in future updates.

The graphics are similar to something you'd find on a Nintendo game: happy and colourful, which is perfect for a casual game like this. Music is fun and chirpy as well, but there are only 2 tracks that repeat so far. It would be nice to hear some new music in the future, as I eventually found myself muting out the repetitive music and playing my own.

Optimization isn't great on mobile hardware currently (about 30 fps on low with a GTX965m) but runs great on my main PC and my friends one also. This game is very early into its roadmap so that's to be expected, and not really a huge problem right now. I think i'll probably get another 15-20 hours of fun from this game until they release more content.

8/10

With workshop support and new maps/reward system and skins coming soon you'll want to get on board straight away!

All in all a great little time consuming, semi-competitive mini golf game with boundless creativity that shows great promise if (like the community believes) the developers stay as passionate as they are already.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is a very fun game to play with friends. It is definitely worth it for the low price tag even though there is not much content at the moment (more is on the way).

Maps

The two maps that currently come with the game are very replayable and I have not noticed many bugs in them at all so far. One of them is called Forest and the other Oasis. At the moment Forest contains less bugs than Oasis which contains a few minor ones.

Multiplayer

The mulitplayer lacks players but it is very easy to create your own server and you can play with up to 12 people. Joining servers is not as easy though as you have to go through a list of about 12 pages. A search tool would make this much easier.

Customisation

Customisation is also available in the game with the ability to change the colour of the ball. As well as this, you can customise your server settings to change the way you play the game. For example, you can change the shape of the balls to eggs and add an ability to jump whilst playing.

Graphics 7/10
Replayability 9/10
Bugs 7/10
Multiplayer 8/10
Overall 7.75/10

In my opinion this game is definitely worth a try and I think it is the best mini golf game out there.

Early Access Review

10/10 Golf with your Friends is honestly worthy of GOTY. Here's why;

Music: The music is mind-blowing for lack of better words. It is capable of giving you a wide arrange of fealings from happiness to legitimate depression and agony. I would absolutely recommend turning it up to max as you enjoy/scream through your game of Mini-Golf with your friends. The composer has truely accomplished a feat with the one repeating song that plays throughout the entire game.

Physics: The physics in this game are surprisingly realistic and fair. That is, unless you change them so you're on the moon. Which brings me to my next point.

Options/Customization: Do you not like your white ball? Change it to hot pink! Not like that you can't collide with your friends? Make it so you can! Not like the gravity? Drag a bar and take a trip to Mars! Not like being in 3rd Person? Use the scroll wheel to go into 1st Person mode! I was actually surprised with the amount of things you could change in this game, which is actually cheaper than the average sandwhich. Use that logic to convince your friends to buy this game so you don't have to play it by yourself. Trust me, It worked for me.

Overall Graphics: For an early access game this is top tier. Honestly. The screenshots aren't cutscenes, there actually aren't any cutscenes in this game, I mean it's mini-golf why would there be? All the screenshots are in game footage. Crazy huh?

It's Balanced: All the courses in this game are very well balanced, which suprised me since this is a golfing game. (aside for the ones you can access by turning on beta content, those need some work. Like ffs the Twilight map is hard af)

Blacklight Interactive has done something spectacular with this game and I cannot wait for the Bogey Boy DLC. Great work guys.

I've had more time to play now so I can give a more thorough review.

TLDR: Amazing game to play with friends at a great low price.

Pros:

Each course lasts around a half hour, so your games aren't dragged out.

Simple controls. All you have to do is hold the left click and pull back the mouse.

Runs great on most computers

There's a ton more pros but you guys get the idea.


Cons:

Not a lot of players. Game came out Janurary 30th and didn't get featured on the front page of Steam, so it might be awhile before the playerbase gets heavier.

Only two courses, 18 holes each. They are currently working on some other courses and the potential of a content creator added.

Some glitches. Just about all non game breaking.

---

As you can see there are tons of reasons to by this game, the big one being it's not like other horrible early access games that are just buggy messes. It's $6, definitely worth it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

For an early access game, with little to no content... I have never had so much fun playing a video game in YEARS now, Golf with Friends is easily the funnest thing I have ever done.

The game itself is extremely well polished for early access, if they didn't say on the store page, they could have easily sold this as a full release and nobody would question it, even with only two courses (18 holes each) it's so well done.

The music is very happy sounding, and quite addicting, it repeats on a loop basically forever... But you don't even notice it, even on a loop it's just that fitting to the game.  I could listen to this on a daily basis and still love it.

The physics of the game are almost flawless, with a little skill you can predict exactly where the ball will go, and sink that hole in one every time.

The courses, for there only being two... Are beautifully designed, with the classics such as windmills... All the way to being eaten by a sphinx, going throughout it's body, and being launched out into a temple of doom.
You've also got loops, half pipes, bouncing platforms that launch your ball all over, bank shots off pillars, running along the walls, fake holes that launch you off the course. They've got it all!

It's a lot of fun playing singleplayer, sadly there are no AI so you're all alone, but it's decent fun.
But once you add even a single friend to the game... Oh boy, get ready for one hell of a time! The more you add, the more fun it is.  Exponentially more fun, when on Skype or other method of talking to your other players.

The dev team for this game is very small, only two people, but they are extremely active in the community discussions, taking suggestions, helping with issues, and are just providing an outstanding experience for their users.

10/10 game, 15/10 devs.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

For an early access game, with little to no content... I have never had so much fun playing a video game in YEARS now, Golf with Friends is easily the funnest thing I have ever done.

The game itself is extremely well polished for early access, if they didn't say on the store page, they could have easily sold this as a full release and nobody would question it, even with only two courses (18 holes each) it's so well done.

The music is very happy sounding, and quite addicting, it repeats on a loop basically forever... But you don't even notice it, even on a loop it's just that fitting to the game.  I could listen to this on a daily basis and still love it.

The physics of the game are almost flawless, with a little skill you can predict exactly where the ball will go, and sink that hole in one every time.

The courses, for there only being two... Are beautifully designed, with the classics such as windmills... All the way to being eaten by a sphinx, going throughout it's body, and being launched out into a temple of doom.
You've also got loops, half pipes, bouncing platforms that launch your ball all over, bank shots off pillars, running along the walls, fake holes that launch you off the course. They've got it all!

It's a lot of fun playing singleplayer, sadly there are no AI so you're all alone, but it's decent fun.
But once you add even a single friend to the game... Oh boy, get ready for one hell of a time! The more you add, the more fun it is.  Exponentially more fun, when on Skype or other method of talking to your other players.

The dev team for this game is very small, only two people, but they are extremely active in the community discussions, taking suggestions, helping with issues, and are just providing an outstanding experience for their users.

10/10 game, 15/10 devs.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I played this with 3 friends and had the time of my life. This game is just fun. There's really no other way to describe it.

Pros:
Customisation - Balls can be customised to a colour and the lobby host can change the physics of the game by changing the ball shape, gravity, bounce height, toggling collisions with other players, etc. Makes for a laugh with low gravity, bouncy eggs.
Simplicity - The game is simple with a minimalist art style, runs on pretty much any machine very well. Do note that 'Medium' and 'High' settings have their FPS capped, where as 'low' is uncapped.
Fun - Just, fun. Like a game should be.
Affordable - Definitely worth the price, an absolute blast to play.

Cons:
Maps - only two maps at the moment, however these are very cool. I especially like the Oasis map as it has some really cool features like the river section.

Dear devs:

Please add workshop compatibility later in development, it would be awesome to have the community make custom maps, also please make more maps of your own as I love the level design currently in game!

Overall verdict:
Fun, easy to run, affordable - get it, especially if you like mini golf.

Great mini-golf game.  Early Access is more about lack of content than stability.  My friend and I hit one bad bug in the time we played, but other than that the game is pretty solid.

Right now the biggest draw back is that there are only two maps and only one mode (as of Jan 30th 2016), but as long as more content comes in this is shaping up to be an amazing minigolf game.

The netcode seems to work without a hitch, but that might be more because that everyone plays their turn asynchronously without having to wait for anyone else.  So 8 player games will go just as fast as a 2-player game, skillset obviously affecting the time.

My favorite golf games are Kirby's Dream Course and Tee It Up (XBLA) so I've always favored a more arcade type golf experience.

Very interested to see what type of modes open up as the game progresses, like power-ups etc.

Pros:
+Pretty Stable for an *alpha* game
+Online Multiplayer works great
+Games are fast without much waiting
+Auto Spectate after you've finished your hole
+Level design for the first two maps are very cool

Cons:
-Limited amount of content (which should be fixed provided that more maps and modes come)

It's Pretty Good. TLDR at Bottom
This review is mostly compiled from what I have seen on the game's discussions

It's a really good game for early access with only 2 developers. The devs are very active and friendly with the community and seem to take suggestions/criticism very well. They are very helpful when it comes to helping someone fix an issue. From what I have played I have not encountered any bugs, but if someone is to come across a bug/glitch they can make a post about it on the discussions and relax knowing that the devs will notice it and work on fixing it. There's usually an update with new features around every month, but there seems to be a lot of bugfix updates usually every week at least.

Not much to it as of right now, but that'll change over time. There's only 2 maps currently and they can be completed fairly quickly. Once you get bored of playing the maps on classic you can always do a challenge mode that involves changing the timer or mac strokes for each hole. And if that still isn't interesting enough there's modifiers like ball shapes and so on. It's best to play this game with friends because it's not nearly as fun alone. You can always play online with randoms, but that requires stable internet (that which I do not have) so I don't know how well that is, but I've seen very few people complain about the community or the lag so that's good.

If you have good internet and friends, then I'd say go ahead and buy the game. However, I wouldn't recommend buying it right now if you're like me and can't play games online. Technically speaking it's unplayable for me due to the fact that you have to be connected to the servers in order to play, but that's more of an issue for me. I'm certain I'll be able to recommend it 100% when they add local multiplayer, bots, and offline play.

TLDR
Great game. Amazing devs.  Not much content currently. Worth it if planning to play online. Should probably wait if planning to play offline.
